docs.snippet: SANDHAUS--Jody. April 29, 1951-July 17, 2012. Graduated from CWRU in 1973. All of her friends and family in Pound Ridge mourn her passing. She is survived by her loving children Hayes, Guss, and Peter Luca; husband Peter; brother Bobby and sister ...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANDHAUS--Jody. April 29, 1951-July 17, 2012. Graduated from CWRU in 1973. All of her friends and family in Pound Ridge mourn her passing. She is survived by her loving children Hayes, Guss, and Peter Luca; husband Peter; brother Bobby and sister Jane. Her music and beautiful singing voice will live on forever. We love you and will miss you. The Firestein Family

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BAUER, EMILY JANE

docs.snippet: BAUER--Emily Jane, on July 19, 2012. Beloved wife of Peter Bauer and daughter of Elizabeth Flesch. Loving mother of Victoria Nadler (Mark) and David Bauer (Alison). Cherished grandmother of Audrey, Stephen, Benjamin, Matthew, and Daniel. We love y...
docs.lead_paragraph: BAUER--Emily Jane, on July 19, 2012. Beloved wife of Peter Bauer and daughter of Elizabeth Flesch. Loving mother of Victoria Nadler (Mark) and David Bauer (Alison). Cherished grandmother of Audrey, Stephen, Benjamin, Matthew, and Daniel. We love you and miss you. Contributions can be made to Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center, P.O. Box 27106, New York, NY 10087-7106.

docs.snippet: A fight surrounding women's participation in canoeing has moved to the British court system.     Competitive canoeist Samantha Rippington filed a challenge Thursday against the London Organizing Committee claiming that the lack of women's canoeing...
docs.abstract: Samantha Rippington files a challenge in British court charging that the lack of women's canoeing events at the Olympics constitutes discrimination. (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: A fight surrounding women's participation in canoeing has moved to the British court system. Competitive canoeist Samantha Rippington filed a challenge Thursday against the London Organizing Committee claiming that the lack of women's canoeing events at the Olympics constitutes discrimination against women.

headline.main: Nasdaq Raises Remuneration In Facebook I.P.O.

docs.snippet: 10:37 p.m. | Updated with filing.     Nasdaq is increasing the amount of money it will offer to customers who lost money during the bungled Facebook initial public offering....
docs.abstract: Nasdaq increases the compensation it will offer to customers who lost money during the bungled Facebook initial public offering; has set aside $62 million in cash, up from its initial pledge of $40 million. (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: 10:37 p.m. | Updated with filing. Nasdaq is increasing the amount of money it will offer to customers who lost money during the bungled Facebook initial public offering.

docs.snippet: A report in the Inside Art column on Friday about the appointment of Eungie Joo to a post at Inhotim, a nonprofit contemporary art center, art park and botanical garden in Brazil, misstated part of the title of her position at the New Museum in Ma...
docs.lead_paragraph: A report in the Inside Art column on Friday about the appointment of Eungie Joo to a post at Inhotim, a nonprofit contemporary art center, art park and botanical garden in Brazil, misstated part of the title of her position at the New Museum in Manhattan, which she will be leaving. She is director and curator of education and public programs, not of public planning.

docs.snippet: An official said Friday said the White House supported a moment of silence during the London Games as a memorial to the athletes who were killed at the Munich Games 40 years ago.     ''Yes, we absolutely support the campaign for a moment of silenc...
docs.abstract: Spokesman for the National Security Council says the White House supports a moment of silence during the London Games as a memorial to the athletes killed at the Munich Games in 1972. (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: An official said Friday said the White House supported a moment of silence during the London Games as a memorial to the athletes who were killed at the Munich Games 40 years ago. ''Yes, we absolutely support the campaign for a moment of silence at the Olympics to honor the Israeli athletes killed in Munich,'' Tommy Vietor, a spokesman for the National Security Council, said in a statement.
